subject: Art & Design
title: Dada: The Anti-Art Movement
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Dada: The Anti-Art Movement.

hook.text: In 1917, Marcel Duchamp put a urinal in a gallery and signed it 'R. Mutt.' It was art.

buildup.text: Dada was born in Zurich during WWI. Artists disgusted by war rejected all logic and tradition.

discovery.text: Dadaists used randomness, absurdity, and provocation to challenge what 'art' even means.

twist.text: Dada was anti-art â€” but by making anti-art, they expanded art's definition permanently.

climax.text: Without Dada, there's no Pop Art, no conceptual art, no Banksy, no meme culture.

punchline.text: They tried to destroy art. They accidentally saved it.

quiz.question: What was the Dada movement's primary goal?
options: To challenge and reject traditional definitions of art
